attributes.title: Other Ingredients
attributes.description: Created on November 25, 2010 by leo on Sourcemap.org.

attributes.name: SOY
attributes.title: SOY
attributes.description: Our soybean farmers use high-yield seeds, organic farming practices, and are non-GMO – a triple win proposition!

attributes.name: VANILLA
attributes.title: VANILLA
attributes.description:
Vanilla grows in a very narrow geographical  band, between 10 and 20 degrees north and south of the Equator.

Most of the world’s vanilla is produced by small-scale, individual family growers. A typical family cares for 1 – 1.5 acres of vanilla vines.

attributes.name: COCOA
attributes.title: COCOA
attributes.description: Latin America produces over 70% of the world’s organic cocoa, and the Dominican Republic is the world’s leading organic cocoa supplier.

attributes.name: COCOA
attributes.title: COCOA
attributes.description: Latin America produces over 70% of the world’s organic cocoa, and the Dominican Republic is the world’s leading organic cocoa supplier.

attributes.name: VANILLA
attributes.title: VANILLA
attributes.description:
Madagascar produces 70% of the world’s supply of vanilla; few other countries could become viable commercial vanilla origins at current price levels because vanilla cultivation and curing are very labor intensive and require unique climate conditions.

Most Vanilla is grown under a rain forest canopy.  It is one of the few commercial agricultural products that does not require clear cutting.

Created with Admarket's flickrSLiDR.

attributes.name: Fish Oil for Omega 3
attributes.title: Fish Oil for Omega 3
attributes.description:
The use of fish oil for omega 3 production accounts for only  4% of the global fish production.

The Omega 3 comes from  a byproduct of the fish meal industry from the anchovy and sardine fishery in Peru

Click here to read a press release on our MSC certified fish oil
Click here to read a press release on our MSC certified fish oilE

attributes.name: VANILLA
attributes.title: VANILLA
attributes.description:
Vanilla grows in a very narrow geographical  band,between 10 and 20 degrees north and south of the Equator.

Did you know that vanilla is cultivated from an orchid plant? 


It takes more than one year to produce vanilla beans - from the time that vanilla orchids are pollinated to the time that they are cured and ready for export.


Created with Admarket's flickrSLiDR.
